meanings.definition: The quality of being shy or reserved.
meanings.sent1: Her introversion made it difficult for her to speak up in class.
meanings.sent2: His introversion often led others to mistake his quiet nature for aloofness.
meanings.sent3: Despite her introversion, she found solace in writing poetry.
meanings.sent4: The introversion of the forest was broken only by the chirping of birds.
meanings.sent5: The introversion of the turtle was evident as it retreated into its shell at the slightest noise.

meanings.definition: The tendency to focus on one's own thoughts and feelings rather than external stimuli.
meanings.sent1: His introversion often led him to get lost in his own thoughts for hours.
meanings.sent2: The introversion of the artist allowed her to create deeply introspective paintings.
meanings.sent3: In a moment of introversion, he completely forgot about the world around him.
meanings.sent4: The introversion of the library was palpable as everyone was engrossed in their books.
meanings.sent5: The introversion of the mountain was reflected in the stillness of the surrounding landscape.
